How to Replace the First Instance of a String in C# by Amr Saafan
posts.caption: amrsaafan.blogspot.com
posts.description: Assume that you have a string and you expect that this string might have some duplicated instances. String.Replace() is very good Function, but it will replace all the instances of the string. So to accomplish this you need to replace the first instance you find. posts.message: With "Object.observe()" Google is taking the extra mile for data-driven js apps .. Object.observe() now has a built-in support starting from Chrome 36 .. and a polyfill is even provided for older browsers https://github.com/Polymer/observe-js
posts.caption: www.html5rocks.com
posts.description: Learn about Object.observe() - a new feature giving JavaScript the power to directly observe changes to objects.

posts.message:
Hey Geeksphere.

Any recommendations for a "Marketing Automation" software?

We are currently using:
* Sendy for Newsletter/blasts
* Bitrix24 for CRM
* Wordpress for website

In case background is needed about marketing automation:
http://www.marketo.com/ebooks/graduating-from-email-marketing-to-marketing-automation/

http://www.hubspot.com/products/marketing-automation
posts.caption: www.marketo.com
posts.description: We’d like to show you what marketing automation can do for you and help you decide if your organization is ready to graduate to a marketing automation solution.

posts.message:
Senior /Team Lead .Net developer is required in  company BITELEMEA.com

Experience: 5-7 years

Ability to build high-quality and high-performance applications on the Microsoft technology stack.
Proven .NET experience as well as a solid understanding of Object Oriented Design and programming
Strong software analysis, architecture development and design skills.
Solid Experience in ASP .NET &  MVC .
Solid Experience in WCF and web services programming,
Familiar with design patterns. 
HTML5, JavaScript using jQuery and other JS Libraries,
 Expertise in SQL Server Database design 
if anyone interested send to : moataz.omar@wind-is.com
